Winning American Idol does so much for someone's musical occupation. Many past winners are pretty rich and while they're no longer all family names, lots of them are recognized as having a ton of skill.

Ruben Studdard used to be the winner of the show's 2d season, and he has been doing really well ever since. Let's take a look at what happened to him after he took home that massive prize in 2003.

An "Amazing" Experience

He mentioned that many hopefuls who display up on audition day have performed numerous different things in an strive to become singers. Studdard talked about how long and hard he labored. He said, "You know, that was my story. You know, I started doing everything I could since I was 12 years old to be, you know, to get discovered or, you know, go to XYZ audition, send in demo tapes."

Studdard persisted that when he was once ready to audition for Idol, it was once the suitable time. He said, "And the blessing is that I was prepared for the opportunity when it presented itself. My mother used to always tell me that preparation determines your destination. And I prepared myself to be ready when that door opened for me."

Album number six is called Unconditional Love and used to be released in 2014.

The couple got married in 2008, according to People.com, and they broke up due to "irreconcilable variations."
